key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs priced lower than the Air France website on 48.6 % of itineraries last week and the share continues to climb, although the average discount is only ‑0.03 %.
Metasearch engines undercut the website on 79.5 % of offers, yet the gap is modest (-0.06 %) and shrinking as parity improves.
Global distribution systems priced 79.5 % of itineraries higher, with an 11 % average markup and parity eroding further.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 48.6 % of fares were cheaper on OTAs last week, up 1.8 ppts WoW; average discount holds at ‑0.03 %.
71.3 % of France-origin routes are OTA-lower and the share is still rising (+2.1 ppts WoW).
41.5 % of long-haul itineraries are OTA-higher, signalling parity gaps rather than undercutting risk.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Share of OTA-lower offers reached 48.6 % (+1.8 ppts WoW, +1.0 ppt MoM) while discounts remain minimal.
Price parity fell to 26.9 % (-0.9 ppt WoW) as more itineraries move into the OTA-lower bucket.
OTA-higher cases dipped to 19.7 % and carry only a +0.19 % premium, limiting dilution if customers compare.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: OTAs are cheaper on 61.9 % of short-haul routes; discount unchanged at ‑0.03 %.
43.4 % of long-haul ODs sit at parity; OTA-lower is negligible (0.4 %).

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 71.3 % OTA-lower versus 0.9 % OTA-higher; discounting intensity keeps rising.
Outside France, 58.7 % of ODs are OTA-higher (avg +0.19 %), indicating inverse pricing dynamic.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA-lower on 43.3 % of 0-7-day departures; OTA-higher moderate at 22.5 %.
57.9 % OTA-lower for >21-day bookings, up 3.4 ppts WoW; OTA-higher only 14.8 %.

mse_highlights.line_content: 79.5 % of itineraries are cheaper on MSE, though average gap is just ‑0.06 %.
Identical pricing jumped to 18.1 % (+4 ppts WoW) as undercut share shrinks.
Website fare missing on 10 % of long-haul searches, risking leakage on high-value routes.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: MSE-lower still at 79.5 % but down 3.6 ppts WoW, suggesting tightening controls.
Parity at 18.1 % reached a quarterly high (+4 ppts WoW).

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 91 % of short-haul ODs undercut, with ‑0.07 % average gap.
50 % parity, 39 % undercut, but 10 % of fares missing entirely.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Undercut share fell to 48.6 %; parity nearly matches at 47.5 %.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 77 % MSE-lower; parity up to 20.6 % (+5 ppts WoW).

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS priced higher on 79.5 % of itineraries, with an 11 % average markup.
89 % of short-haul routes see a 12 % GDS premium.
Parity fell to 14.2 % (-0.4 ppt WoW, ‑1.2 ppts MoM).

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 79.5 % higher pricing (+1.0 ppt WoW) with double-digit premiums.
5.7 % of web fares absent in GDS, slightly improved vs. last week.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 89.2 % higher with 12 % gap; trend still worsening.
44.5 % higher, 41.8 % parity, but ‘higher’ share grew 2.1 ppts WoW.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 76.4 % higher pricing, 13 % premium; parity 20.8 % but declining.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 76.9 % higher with 7 % premium; parity at 16.5 % and falling.
